issue.title: Close apply force/torque dialog when entering editors

content.raw:
I was trying to work this out, I was considering to get all the models from the world and then for all the links in the model, check whether ApplyWrenchDialog is exists or not, for the ones it exist, delete it.

For the same I had to use physics::get_world(string const&), which is included by physics/physics.hh
But on compiling I get :

libgazebo_gui.so.7.0.0: undefined reference to `gazebo::physics::get_world(std::string const&)'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status

I need to make changes to cmake files, so as to include physics.hh, but I am not sure how to go ahead with it. Can someone help me in it?

Do you think the error is due to some other reasons?

I was trying to work this out, I was considering to get all the models from the world and then for all the links in the model, check whether ApplyWrenchDialog is exists or not, for the ones it exist, delete it.

For the same I had to use physics::get_world(string const&), which is included by physics/physics.hh But on compiling I get :

I need to make changes to cmake files, so as to include physics.hh, but I am not sure how to go ahead with it. Can someone help me in it?
